intro: Asaphes undulata, commonly known as the wavy asaphes, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with wavy margins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Asaphes undulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
